definition: Nian Army, leading a peasant rebellion against the Qing dynasty in Shandong, Henan, Jiangsu and Anhui 1851-1868, at the same time as the Taiping Rebellion further south

sentences.english: Shandong local community undergone a change after the Nien was to be put down.
sentences.chinese: 山东地方社会在平定捻军后经历着一场变革。

sentences.english: The siege campaign on Yingzhou was a major warfare in the Nian Army's history.
sentences.chinese: 颍州围城战役是捻军史上的重大战事。

definition: Hunan army, irregular force formed in 1850s to fight the Taiping heavenly kingdom rebellion
north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
the Righteous and Harmonious Fists/the Boxers (history)
the Qing court (as government of China)
local militia formed to suppress peasant rebellion (old)
Green standard army, standing infantry during Qing dynasty, originally formed from Ming and other Chinese army units
Ming and Qing dynasty province directly administered by Beijing, including Beijing, Tianjin, most of Hebei and Henan and part of Shandong
the Righteous and Harmonious Fists/the Boxers (history)
Hunan army, irregular force formed in 1850s to fight the Taiping heavenly kingdom rebellion
Zuo Zongtang (1812-1885), Chinese administrator and military leader
anti-Qing/refers to the revolutionary movements in late 19th and early 20th century leading up to 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4]
the Red Turbans, peasant rebellion at the end of the Yuan dynasty
